                     <div class="line">And he wants wit that wants resolved will</div>
                     <div class="line">To learn his wit to exchange the bad for better.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, fie, unreverend tongue! to call her bad,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose sovereignty so oft thou hast preferr'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With twenty thousand soul-confirming oaths.</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot leave to love, and yet I do;</div>
                     <div class="line">But there I leave to love where I should love.</div>
                     <div class="line">Julia I lose and Valentine I lose:</div>
                     <div class="line">If I keep them, I needs must lose myself;</div>
                     <div class="line">If I lose them, thus find I by their loss</div>
                     <div class="line">For Valentine myself, for Julia Silvia.</div>
                     <div class="line">I to myself am dearer than a friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">For love is still most precious in itself;</div>
                     <div class="line">And Silvia--witness Heaven, that made her fair!--</div>
                     <div class="line">Shows Julia but a swarthy Ethiope.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will forget that Julia is alive,</div>
                     <div class="line">Remembering that my love to her is dead;</div>
                     <div class="line">And Valentine I'll hold an enemy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Aiming at Silvia as a sweeter friend.</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot now prove constant to myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without some treachery used to Valentine.</div>
                     <div class="line">This night he meaneth with a corded ladder</div>
                     <div class="line">To climb celestial Silvia's chamber-window,</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself in counsel, his competitor.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now presently I'll give her father notice</div>
                     <div class="line">Of their disguising and pretended flight;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, all enraged, will banish Valentine;</div>
                     <div class="line">For Thurio, he intends, shall wed his daughter;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, Valentine being gone, I'll quickly cross</div>
                     <div class="line">By some sly trick blunt Thurio's dull proceeding.</div>
                     <div class="line">Love, lend me wings to make my purpose swift,</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou hast lent me wit to plot this drift!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.8">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>7. SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JULIA and LUCETTA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Counsel, Lucetta; gentle girl, assist me;</div>
                     <div class="line">And even in kind love I do conjure thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who art the table wherein all my thoughts</div>
                     <div class="line">Are visibly character'd and engraved,</div>
                     <div class="line">To lesson me and tell me some good mean</div>
                     <div class="line">How, with my honour, I may undertake</div>
                     <div class="line">A journey to my loving Proteus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, the way is wearisome and long!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">A true-devoted pilgrim is not weary</div>
                     <div class="line">To measure kingdoms with his feeble steps;</div>
                     <div class="line">Much less shall she that hath Love's wings to fly,</div>
                     <div class="line">And when the flight is made to one so dear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of such divine perfection, as Sir Proteus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Better forbear till Proteus make return.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, know'st thou not his looks are my soul's food?</div>
                     <div class="line">Pity the dearth that I have pined in,</div>
                     <div class="line">By longing for that food so long a time.</div>
                     <div class="line">Didst thou but know the inly touch of love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wouldst as soon go kindle fire with snow</div>
                     <div class="line">As seek to quench the fire of love with words.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not seek to quench your love's hot fire,</div>
                     <div class="line">But qualify the fire's extreme rage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest it should burn above the bounds of reason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">The more thou damm'st it up, the more it burns.</div>
                     <div class="line">The current that with gentle murmur glides,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou know'st, being stopp'd, impatiently doth rage;</div>
                     <div class="line">But when his fair course is not hindered,</div>
                     <div class="line">He makes sweet music with the enamell'ed stones,</div>
                     <div class="line">Giving a gentle kiss to every sedge</div>
                     <div class="line">He overtaketh in his pilgrimage,</div>
                     <div class="line">And so by many winding nooks he strays</div>
                     <div class="line">With willing sport to the wild ocean.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let me go and hinder not my course</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be as patient as a gentle stream</div>
                     <div class="line">And make a pastime of each weary step,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till the last step have brought me to my love;</div>
                     <div class="line">And there I'll rest, as after much turmoil</div>
                     <div class="line">A blessed soul doth in Elysium.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">But in what habit will you go along?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Not like a woman; for I would prevent</div>
                     <div class="line">The loose encounters of lascivious men:</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentle Lucetta, fit me with such weeds</div>
                     <div class="line">As may beseem some well-reputed page.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, your ladyship must cut your hair.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, girl, I'll knit it up in silken strings</div>
                     <div class="line">With twenty odd-conceited true-love knots.</div>
                     <div class="line">To be fantastic may become a youth</div>
                     <div class="line">Of greater time than I shall show to be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">What fashion, madam shall I make your breeches?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">That fits as well as 'Tell me, good my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">What compass will you wear your farthingale?'</div>
                     <div class="line">Why even what fashion thou best likest, Lucetta.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">You must needs have them with a codpiece, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, out, Lucetta! that would be ill-favour'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">A round hose, madam, now's not worth a pin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless you have a codpiece to stick pins on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Lucetta, as thou lovest me, let me have</div>
                     <div class="line">What thou thinkest meet and is most mannerly.</div>
                     <div class="line">But tell me, wench, how will the world repute me</div>
                     <div class="line">For undertaking so unstaid a journey?</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear me, it will make me scandalized.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">If you think so, then stay at home and go not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, that I will not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then never dream on infamy, but go.</div>
                     <div class="line">If Proteus like your journey when you come,</div>
                     <div class="line">No matter who's displeased when you are gone:</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear me, he will scarce be pleased withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">That is the least, Lucetta, of my fear:</div>
                     <div class="line">A thousand oaths, an ocean of his tears</div>
                     <div class="line">And instances of infinite of love</div>
                     <div class="line">Warrant me welcome to my Proteus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">All these are servants to deceitful men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Base men, that use them to so base effect!</div>
                     <div class="line">But truer stars did govern Proteus' birth</div>
                     <div class="line">His words are bonds, his oaths are oracles,</div>
                     <div class="line">His love sincere, his thoughts immaculate,</div>
                     <div class="line">His tears pure messengers sent from his heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">His heart as far from fraud as heaven from earth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray heaven he prove so, when you come to him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, as thou lovest me, do him not that wrong</div>
                     <div class="line">To bear a hard opinion of his truth:</div>
                     <div class="line">Only deserve my love by loving him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And presently go with me to my chamber,</div>
                     <div class="line">To take a note of what I stand in need of,</div>
                     <div class="line">To furnish me upon my longing journey.</div>
                     <div class="line">All that is mine I leave at thy dispose,</div>
                     <div class="line">My goods, my lands, my reputation;</div>
                     <div class="line">Only, in lieu thereof, dispatch me hence.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, answer not, but to it presently!</div>
                     <div class="line">I am impatient of my tarriance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DUKE, THURIO, and PROTEUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Thurio, give us leave, I pray, awhile;</div>
                     <div class="line">We have some secrets to confer about.</div>
                     <p>Exit THURIO</p>
                     <div class="line">Now, tell me, Proteus, what's your will with me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My gracious lord, that which I would discover</div>
                     <div class="line">The law of friendship bids me to conceal;</div>
                     <div class="line">But when I call to mind your gracious favours</div>
                     <div class="line">Done to me, undeserving as I am,</div>
                     <div class="line">My duty pricks me on to utter that</div>
                     <div class="line">Which else no worldly good should draw from me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Know, worthy prince, Sir Valentine, my friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">This night intends to steal away your daughter:</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself am one made privy to the plot.</div>
                     <div class="line">I know you have determined to bestow her</div>
                     <div class="line">On Thurio, whom your gentle daughter hates;</div>
                     <div class="line">And should she thus be stol'n away from you,</div>
                     <div class="line">It would be much vexation to your age.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus, for my duty's sake, I rather chose</div>
                     <div class="line">To cross my friend in his intended drift</div>
                     <div class="line">Than, by concealing it, heap on your head</div>
                     <div class="line">A pack of sorrows which would press you down,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being unprevented, to your timeless grave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Proteus, I thank thee for thine honest care;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which to requite, command me while I live.</div>
                     <div class="line">This love of theirs myself have often seen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Haply when they have judged me fast asleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">And oftentimes have purposed to forbid</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Valentine her company and my court:</div>
                     <div class="line">But fearing lest my jealous aim might err</div>
                     <div class="line">And so unworthily disgrace the man,</div>
                     <div class="line">A rashness that I ever yet have shunn'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">I gave him gentle looks, thereby to find</div>
                     <div class="line">That which thyself hast now disclosed to me.</div>
                     <div class="line">And, that thou mayst perceive my fear of this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Knowing that tender youth is soon suggested,</div>
                     <div class="line">I nightly lodge her in an upper tower,</div>
                     <div class="line">The key whereof myself have ever kept;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thence she cannot be convey'd away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Know, noble lord, they have devised a mean</div>
                     <div class="line">How he her chamber-window will ascend</div>
                     <div class="line">And with a corded ladder fetch her down;</div>
                     <div class="line">For which the youthful lover now is gone</div>
                     <div class="line">And this way comes he with it presently;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where, if it please you, you may intercept him.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, good my Lord, do it so cunningly</div>
                     <div class="line">That my discovery be not aimed at;</div>
                     <div class="line">For love of you, not hate unto my friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath made me publisher of this pretence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon mine honour, he shall never know</div>
                     <div class="line">That I had any light from thee of this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Adieu, my Lord; Sir Valentine is coming.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter VALENTINE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Valentine, whither away so fast?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Please it your grace, there is a messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">That stays to bear my letters to my friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am going to deliver them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Be they of much import?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">The tenor of them doth but signify</div>
                     <div class="line">My health and happy being at your court.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay then, no matter; stay with me awhile;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am to break with thee of some affairs</div>
                     <div class="line">That touch me near, wherein thou must be secret.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not unknown to thee that I have sought</div>
                     <div class="line">To match my friend Sir Thurio to my daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I know it well, my Lord; and, sure, the match</div>
                     <div class="line">Were rich and honourable; besides, the gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Is full of virtue, bounty, worth and qualities</div>
                     <div class="line">Beseeming such a wife as your fair daughter:</div>
                     <div class="line">Cannot your Grace win her to fancy him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, trust me; she is peevish, sullen, froward,</div>
                     <div class="line">Proud, disobedient, stubborn, lacking duty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither regarding that she is my child</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor fearing me as if I were her father;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, may I say to thee, this pride of hers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon advice, hath drawn my love from her;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, where I thought the remnant of mine age</div>
                     <div class="line">Should have been cherish'd by her child-like duty,</div>
                     <div class="line">I now am full resolved to take a wife</div>
                     <div class="line">And turn her out to who will take her in:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let her beauty be her wedding-dower;</div>
                     <div class="line">For me and my possessions she esteems not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">What would your Grace have me to do in this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a lady in Verona here</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom I affect; but she is nice and coy</div>
                     <div class="line">And nought esteems my aged eloquence:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now therefore would I have thee to my tutor--</div>
                     <div class="line">For long agone I have forgot to court;</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, the fashion of the time is changed--</div>
                     <div class="line">How and which way I may bestow myself</div>
                     <div class="line">To be regarded in her sun-bright eye.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Win her with gifts, if she respect not words:</div>
                     <div class="line">Dumb jewels often in their silent kind</div>
                     <div class="line">More than quick words do move a woman's mind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">But she did scorn a present that I sent her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">A woman sometimes scorns what best contents her.</div>
                     <div class="line">Send her another; never give her o'er;</div>
                     <div class="line">For scorn at first makes after-love the more.</div>
                     <div class="line">If she do frown, 'tis not in hate of you,</div>
                     <div class="line">But rather to beget more love in you:</div>
                     <div class="line">If she do chide, 'tis not to have you gone;</div>
                     <div class="line">For why, the fools are mad, if left alone.</div>
                     <div class="line">Take no repulse, whatever she doth say;</div>
                     <div class="line">For 'get you gone,' she doth not mean 'away!'</div>
                     <div class="line">Flatter and praise, commend, extol their graces;</div>
                     <div class="line">Though ne'er so black, say they have angels' faces.</div>
                     <div class="line">That man that hath a tongue, I say, is no man,</div>
                     <div class="line">If with his tongue he cannot win a woman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">But she I mean is promised by her friends</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto a youthful gentleman of worth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And kept severely from resort of men,</div>
                     <div class="line">That no man hath access by day to her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, I would resort to her by night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but the doors be lock'd and keys kept safe,</div>
                     <div class="line">That no man hath recourse to her by night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">What lets but one may enter at her window?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Her chamber is aloft, far from the ground,</div>
                     <div class="line">And built so shelving that one cannot climb it</div>
                     <div class="line">Without apparent hazard of his life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then, a ladder quaintly made of cords,</div>
                     <div class="line">To cast up, with a pair of anchoring hooks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would serve to scale another Hero's tower,</div>
                     <div class="line">So bold Leander would adventure it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, as thou art a gentleman of blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Advise me where I may have such a ladder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">When would you use it? pray, sir, tell me that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">This very night; for Love is like a child,</div>
                     <div class="line">That longs for every thing that he can come by.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">By seven o'clock I'll get you such a ladder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">But, hark thee; I will go to her alone:</div>
                     <div class="line">How shall I best convey the ladder thither?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">It will be light, my lord, that you may bear it</div>
                     <div class="line">Under a cloak that is of any length.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">A cloak as long as thine will serve the turn?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my good lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let me see thy cloak:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll get me one of such another length.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, any cloak will serve the turn, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">How shall I fashion me to wear a cloak?</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, let me feel thy cloak upon me.</div>
                     <div class="line">What letter is this same? What's here? 'To Silvia'!</div>
                     <div class="line">And here an engine fit for my proceeding.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be so bold to break the seal for once.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'My thoughts do harbour with my Silvia nightly,</div>
                     <div class="line">And slaves they are to me that send them flying:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, could their master come and go as lightly,</div>
                     <div class="line">Himself would lodge where senseless they are lying!</div>
                     <div class="line">My herald thoughts in thy pure bosom rest them:</div>
                     <div class="line">While I, their king, that hither them importune,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do curse the grace that with such grace hath bless'd them,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because myself do want my servants' fortune:</div>
                     <div class="line">I curse myself, for they are sent by me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That they should harbour where their lord would be.'</div>
                     <div class="line">What's here?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Silvia, this night I will enfranchise thee.'</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis so; and here's the ladder for the purpose.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Phaeton,--for thou art Merops' son,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou aspire to guide the heavenly car</div>
                     <div class="line">And with thy daring folly burn the world?</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou reach stars, because they shine on thee?</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, base intruder! overweening slave!</div>
                     <div class="line">Bestow thy fawning smiles on equal mates,</div>
                     <div class="line">And think my patience, more than thy desert,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is privilege for thy departure hence:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thank me for this more than for all the favours</div>
                     <div class="line">Which all too much I have bestow'd on thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">But if thou linger in my territories</div>
                     <div class="line">Longer than swiftest expedition</div>
                     <div class="line">Will give thee time to leave our royal court,</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven! my wrath shall far exceed the love</div>
                     <div class="line">I ever bore my daughter or thyself.</div>
                     <div class="line">Be gone! I will not hear thy vain excuse;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, as thou lovest thy life, make speed from hence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">And why not death rather than living torment?</div>
                     <div class="line">To die is to be banish'd from myself;</div>
                     <div class="line">And Silvia is myself: banish'd from her</div>
                     <div class="line">Is self from self: a deadly banishment!</div>
                     <div class="line">What light is light, if Silvia be not seen?</div>
                     <div class="line">What joy is joy, if Silvia be not by?</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless it be to think that she is by</div>
                     <div class="line">And feed upon the shadow of perfection</div>
                     <div class="line">Except I be by Silvia in the night,</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no music in the nightingale;</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless I look on Silvia in the day,</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no day for me to look upon;</div>
                     <div class="line">She is my essence, and I leave to be,</div>
                     <div class="line">If I be not by her fair influence</div>
                     <div class="line">Foster'd, illumined, cherish'd, kept alive.</div>
                     <div class="line">I fly not death, to fly his deadly doom:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tarry I here, I but attend on death:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, fly I hence, I fly away from life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PROTEUS and LAUNCE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Run, boy, run, run, and seek him out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Soho, soho!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What seest thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Him we go to find: there's not a hair on's head</div>
                     <div class="line">but 'tis a Valentine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Valentine?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">No.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who then? his spirit?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Can nothing speak? Master, shall I strike?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who wouldst thou strike?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Villain, forbear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, sir, I'll strike nothing: I pray you,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, I say, forbear. Friend Valentine, a word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">My ears are stopt and cannot hear good news,</div>
                     <div class="line">So much of bad already hath possess'd them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Then in dumb silence will I bury mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">For they are harsh, untuneable and bad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Is Silvia dead?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, Valentine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">No Valentine, indeed, for sacred Silvia.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath she forsworn me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, Valentine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">No Valentine, if Silvia have forsworn me.</div>
                     <div class="line">What is your news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, there is a proclamation that you are vanished.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou art banished--O, that's the news!--</div>
                     <div class="line">From hence, from Silvia and from me thy friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I have fed upon this woe already,</div>
                     <div class="line">And now excess of it will make me surfeit.</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth Silvia know that I am banished?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, ay; and she hath offer'd to the doom--</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, unreversed, stands in effectual force--</div>
                     <div class="line">A sea of melting pearl, which some call tears:</div>
                     <div class="line">Those at her father's churlish feet she tender'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">With them, upon her knees, her humble self;</div>
                     <div class="line">Wringing her hands, whose whiteness so became them</div>
                     <div class="line">As if but now they waxed pale for woe:</div>
                     <div class="line">But neither bended knees, pure hands held up,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sad sighs, deep groans, nor silver-shedding tears,</div>
                     <div class="line">Could penetrate her uncompassionate sire;</div>
                     <div class="line">But Valentine, if he be ta'en, must die.</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, her intercession chafed him so,</div>
                     <div class="line">When she for thy repeal was suppliant,</div>
                     <div class="line">That to close prison he commanded her,</div>
                     <div class="line">With many bitter threats of biding there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">No more; unless the next word that thou speak'st</div>
                     <div class="line">Have some malignant power upon my life:</div>
                     <div class="line">If so, I pray thee, breathe it in mine ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">As ending anthem of my endless dolour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Cease to lament for that thou canst not help,</div>
                     <div class="line">And study help for that which thou lament'st.</div>
                     <div class="line">Time is the nurse and breeder of all good.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here if thou stay, thou canst not see thy love;</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, thy staying will abridge thy life.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hope is a lover's staff; walk hence with that</div>
                     <div class="line">And manage it against despairing thoughts.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy letters may be here, though thou art hence;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, being writ to me, shall be deliver'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the milk-white bosom of thy love.</div>
                     <div class="line">The time now serves not to expostulate:</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, I'll convey thee through the city-gate;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, ere I part with thee, confer at large</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all that may concern thy love-affairs.</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou lovest Silvia, though not for thyself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Regard thy danger, and along with me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, Launce, an if thou seest my boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid him make haste and meet me at the North-gate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, sirrah, find him out. Come, Valentine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">O my dear Silvia! Hapless Valentine!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt VALENTINE and PROTEUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am but a fool, look you; and yet I have the wit to</div>
                     <div class="line">think my master is a kind of a knave: but that's</div>
                     <div class="line">all one, if he be but one knave. He lives not now</div>
                     <div class="line">that knows me to be in love; yet I am in love; but a</div>
                     <div class="line">team of horse shall not pluck that from me; nor who</div>
                     <div class="line">'tis I love; and yet 'tis a woman; but what woman, I</div>
                     <div class="line">will not tell myself; and yet 'tis a milkmaid; yet</div>
                     <div class="line">'tis not a maid, for she hath had gossips; yet 'tis</div>
                     <div class="line">a maid, for she is her master's maid, and serves for</div>
                     <div class="line">wages. She hath more qualities than a water-spaniel;</div>
                     <div class="line">which is much in a bare Christian.</div>
                     <p>Pulling out a paper</p>
                     <div class="line">Here is the cate-log of her condition.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Imprimis: She can fetch and carry.' Why, a horse</div>
                     <div class="line">can do no more: nay, a horse cannot fetch, but only</div>
                     <div class="line">carry; therefore is she better than a jade. 'Item:</div>
                     <div class="line">She can milk;' look you, a sweet virtue in a maid</div>
                     <div class="line">with clean hands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SPEED</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, Signior Launce! what news with your</div>
                     <div class="line">mastership?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">With my master's ship? why, it is at sea.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, your old vice still; mistake the word. What</div>
                     <div class="line">news, then, in your paper?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">The blackest news that ever thou heardest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, man, how black?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, as black as ink.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me read them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie on thee, jolt-head! thou canst not read.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou liest; I can.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">I will try thee. Tell me this: who begot thee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, the son of my grandfather.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O illiterate loiterer! it was the son of thy</div>
                     <div class="line">grandmother: this proves that thou canst not read.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, fool, come; try me in thy paper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">There; and St. Nicholas be thy speed!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Imprimis: She can milk.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, that she can.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She brews good ale.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">And thereof comes the proverb: 'Blessing of your</div>
                     <div class="line">heart, you brew good ale.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She can sew.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">That's as much as to say, Can she so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She can knit.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">What need a man care for a stock with a wench, when</div>
                     <div class="line">she can knit him a stock?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She can wash and scour.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">A special virtue: for then she need not be washed</div>
                     <div class="line">and scoured.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She can spin.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then may I set the world on wheels, when she can</div>
                     <div class="line">spin for her living.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She hath many nameless virtues.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">That's as much as to say, bastard virtues; that,</div>
                     <div class="line">indeed, know not their fathers and therefore have no names.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Here follow her vices.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Close at the heels of her virtues.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She is not to be kissed fasting in respect</div>
                     <div class="line">of her breath.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, that fault may be mended with a breakfast. Read on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She hath a sweet mouth.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">That makes amends for her sour breath.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She doth talk in her sleep.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">It's no matter for that, so she sleep not in her talk.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She is slow in words.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O villain, that set this down among her vices! To</div>
                     <div class="line">be slow in words is a woman's only virtue: I pray</div>
                     <div class="line">thee, out with't, and place it for her chief virtue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She is proud.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Out with that too; it was Eve's legacy, and cannot</div>
                     <div class="line">be ta'en from her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She hath no teeth.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">I care not for that neither, because I love crusts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She is curst.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, the best is, she hath no teeth to bite.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She will often praise her liquor.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">If her liquor be good, she shall: if she will not, I</div>
                     <div class="line">will; for good things should be praised.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She is too liberal.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Of her tongue she cannot, for that's writ down she</div>
                     <div class="line">is slow of; of her purse she shall not, for that</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll keep shut: now, of another thing she may, and</div>
                     <div class="line">that cannot I help. Well, proceed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She hath more hair than wit, and more faults</div>
                     <div class="line">than hairs, and more wealth than faults.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Stop there; I'll have her: she was mine, and not</div>
                     <div class="line">mine, twice or thrice in that last article.</div>
                     <div class="line">Rehearse that once more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'Item: She hath more hair than wit,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">More hair than wit? It may be; I'll prove it. The</div>
                     <div class="line">cover of the salt hides the salt, and therefore it</div>
                     <div class="line">is more than the salt; the hair that covers the wit</div>
                     <div class="line">is more than the wit, for the greater hides the</div>
                     <div class="line">less. What's next?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'And more faults than hairs,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">That's monstrous: O, that that were out!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">'And more wealth than faults.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, that word makes the faults gracious. Well,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have her; and if it be a match, as nothing is</div>
                     <div class="line">impossible,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">What then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then will I tell thee--that thy master stays</div>
                     <div class="line">for thee at the North-gate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">For me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">For thee! ay, who art thou? he hath stayed for a</div>
                     <div class="line">better man than thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">And must I go to him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou must run to him, for thou hast stayed so long</div>
                     <div class="line">that going will scarce serve the turn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">Why didst not tell me sooner? pox of your love letters!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Now will he be swinged for reading my letter; an</div>
                     <div class="line">unmannerly slave, that will thrust himself into</div>
                     <div class="line">secrets! I'll after, to rejoice in the boy's correction.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DUKE and THURIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Thurio, fear not but that she will love you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now Valentine is banish'd from her sight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Since his exile she hath despised me most,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forsworn my company and rail'd at me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I am desperate of obtaining her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">This weak impress of love is as a figure</div>
                     <div class="line">Trenched in ice, which with an hour's heat</div>
                     <div class="line">Dissolves to water and doth lose his form.</div>
                     <div class="line">A little time will melt her frozen thoughts</div>
                     <div class="line">And worthless Valentine shall be forgot.</div>
                     <p>Enter PROTEUS</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, Sir Proteus! Is your countryman</div>
                     <div class="line">According to our proclamation gone?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Gone, my good lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">My daughter takes his going grievously.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A little time, my lord, will kill that grief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">So I believe; but Thurio thinks not so.</div>
                     <div class="line">Proteus, the good conceit I hold of thee--</div>
                     <div class="line">For thou hast shown some sign of good desert--</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes me the better to confer with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Longer than I prove loyal to your grace</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me not live to look upon your grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou know'st how willingly I would effect</div>
                     <div class="line">The match between Sir Thurio and my daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I do, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">And also, I think, thou art not ignorant</div>
                     <div class="line">How she opposes her against my will</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">She did, my lord, when Valentine was here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and perversely she persevers so.</div>
                     <div class="line">What might we do to make the girl forget</div>
                     <div class="line">The love of Valentine and love Sir Thurio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The best way is to slander Valentine</div>
                     <div class="line">With falsehood, cowardice and poor descent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Three things that women highly hold in hate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but she'll think that it is spoke in hate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, if his enemy deliver it:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore it must with circumstance be spoken</div>
                     <div class="line">By one whom she esteemeth as his friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then you must undertake to slander him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And that, my lord, I shall be loath to do:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis an ill office for a gentleman,</div>
