                     <div class="line">Especially against his very friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Where your good word cannot advantage him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your slander never can endamage him;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore the office is indifferent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being entreated to it by your friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You have prevail'd, my lord; if I can do it</div>
                     <div class="line">By ought that I can speak in his dispraise,</div>
                     <div class="line">She shall not long continue love to him.</div>
                     <div class="line">But say this weed her love from Valentine,</div>
                     <div class="line">It follows not that she will love Sir Thurio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, as you unwind her love from him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest it should ravel and be good to none,</div>
                     <div class="line">You must provide to bottom it on me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which must be done by praising me as much</div>
                     <div class="line">As you in worth dispraise Sir Valentine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">And, Proteus, we dare trust you in this kind,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because we know, on Valentine's report,</div>
                     <div class="line">You are already Love's firm votary</div>
                     <div class="line">And cannot soon revolt and change your mind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon this warrant shall you have access</div>
                     <div class="line">Where you with Silvia may confer at large;</div>
                     <div class="line">For she is lumpish, heavy, melancholy,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, for your friend's sake, will be glad of you;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where you may temper her by your persuasion</div>
                     <div class="line">To hate young Valentine and love my friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">As much as I can do, I will effect:</div>
                     <div class="line">But you, Sir Thurio, are not sharp enough;</div>
                     <div class="line">You must lay lime to tangle her desires</div>
                     <div class="line">By wailful sonnets, whose composed rhymes</div>
                     <div class="line">Should be full-fraught with serviceable vows.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay,</div>
                     <div class="line">Much is the force of heaven-bred poesy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Say that upon the altar of her beauty</div>
                     <div class="line">You sacrifice your tears, your sighs, your heart:</div>
                     <div class="line">Write till your ink be dry, and with your tears</div>
                     <div class="line">Moist it again, and frame some feeling line</div>
                     <div class="line">That may discover such integrity:</div>
                     <div class="line">For Orpheus' lute was strung with poets' sinews,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose golden touch could soften steel and stones,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make tigers tame and huge leviathans</div>
                     <div class="line">Forsake unsounded deeps to dance on sands.</div>
                     <div class="line">After your dire-lamenting elegies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Visit by night your lady's chamber-window</div>
                     <div class="line">With some sweet concert; to their instruments</div>
                     <div class="line">Tune a deploring dump: the night's dead silence</div>
                     <div class="line">Will well become such sweet-complaining grievance.</div>
                     <div class="line">This, or else nothing, will inherit her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">This discipline shows thou hast been in love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And thy advice this night I'll put in practise.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, sweet Proteus, my direction-giver,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us into the city presently</div>
                     <div class="line">To sort some gentlemen well skill'd in music.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a sonnet that will serve the turn</div>
                     <div class="line">To give the onset to thy good advice.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">About it, gentlemen!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll wait upon your grace till after supper,</div>
                     <div class="line">And afterward determine our proceedings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Even now about it! I will pardon you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter certain Outlaws</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Fellows, stand fast; I see a passenger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">If there be ten, shrink not, but down with 'em.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter VALENTINE and SPEED</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand, sir, and throw us that you have about ye:</div>
                     <div class="line">If not: we'll make you sit and rifle you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, we are undone; these are the villains</div>
                     <div class="line">That all the travellers do fear so much.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">My friends,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">That's not so, sir: we are your enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace! we'll hear him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, by my beard, will we, for he's a proper man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then know that I have little wealth to lose:</div>
                     <div class="line">A man I am cross'd with adversity;</div>
                     <div class="line">My riches are these poor habiliments,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of which if you should here disfurnish me,</div>
                     <div class="line">You take the sum and substance that I have.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither travel you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">To Verona.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Whence came you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">From Milan.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you long sojourned there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Some sixteen months, and longer might have stay'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">If crooked fortune had not thwarted me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">What, were you banish'd thence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I was.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">For what offence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">For that which now torments me to rehearse:</div>
                     <div class="line">I kill'd a man, whose death I much repent;</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet I slew him manfully in fight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without false vantage or base treachery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, ne'er repent it, if it were done so.</div>
                     <div class="line">But were you banish'd for so small a fault?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I was, and held me glad of such a doom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you the tongues?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">My youthful travel therein made me happy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else I often had been miserable.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">By the bare scalp of Robin Hood's fat friar,</div>
                     <div class="line">This fellow were a king for our wild faction!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll have him. Sirs, a word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SPEED</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, be one of them; it's an honourable kind of thievery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, villain!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell us this: have you any thing to take to?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but my fortune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Know, then, that some of us are gentlemen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such as the fury of ungovern'd youth</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrust from the company of awful men:</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself was from Verona banished</div>
                     <div class="line">For practising to steal away a lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">An heir, and near allied unto the duke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">And I from Mantua, for a gentleman,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, in my mood, I stabb'd unto the heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">And I for such like petty crimes as these,</div>
                     <div class="line">But to the purpose--for we cite our faults,</div>
                     <div class="line">That they may hold excus'd our lawless lives;</div>
                     <div class="line">And partly, seeing you are beautified</div>
                     <div class="line">With goodly shape and by your own report</div>
                     <div class="line">A linguist and a man of such perfection</div>
                     <div class="line">As we do in our quality much want--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, because you are a banish'd man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, above the rest, we parley to you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you content to be our general?</div>
                     <div class="line">To make a virtue of necessity</div>
                     <div class="line">And live, as we do, in this wilderness?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">What say'st thou? wilt thou be of our consort?</div>
                     <div class="line">Say ay, and be the captain of us all:</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll do thee homage and be ruled by thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Love thee as our commander and our king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">But if thou scorn our courtesy, thou diest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt not live to brag what we have offer'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I take your offer and will live with you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Provided that you do no outrages</div>
                     <div class="line">On silly women or poor passengers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Outlaw</div>
                     <div class="line">No, we detest such vile base practises.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, go with us, we'll bring thee to our crews,</div>
                     <div class="line">And show thee all the treasure we have got,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, with ourselves, all rest at thy dispose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PROTEUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Already have I been false to Valentine</div>
                     <div class="line">And now I must be as unjust to Thurio.</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the colour of commending him,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have access my own love to prefer:</div>
                     <div class="line">But Silvia is too fair, too true, too holy,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be corrupted with my worthless gifts.</div>
                     <div class="line">When I protest true loyalty to her,</div>
                     <div class="line">She twits me with my falsehood to my friend;</div>
                     <div class="line">When to her beauty I commend my vows,</div>
                     <div class="line">She bids me think how I have been forsworn</div>
                     <div class="line">In breaking faith with Julia whom I loved:</div>
                     <div class="line">And notwithstanding all her sudden quips,</div>
                     <div class="line">The least whereof would quell a lover's hope,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, spaniel-like, the more she spurns my love,</div>
                     <div class="line">The more it grows and fawneth on her still.</div>
                     <div class="line">But here comes Thurio: now must we to her window,</div>
                     <div class="line">And give some evening music to her ear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter THURIO and Musicians</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, Sir Proteus, are you crept before us?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, gentle Thurio: for you know that love</div>
                     <div class="line">Will creep in service where it cannot go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but I hope, sir, that you love not here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, but I do; or else I would be hence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who? Silvia?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, Silvia; for your sake.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you for your own. Now, gentlemen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's tune, and to it lustily awhile.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter, at a distance, Host, and JULIA in boy's clothes</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, my young guest, methinks you're allycholly: I</div>
                     <div class="line">pray you, why is it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, mine host, because I cannot be merry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, we'll have you merry: I'll bring you where</div>
                     <div class="line">you shall hear music and see the gentleman that you asked for.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">But shall I hear him speak?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, that you shall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">That will be music.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Music plays</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark, hark!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Is he among these?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay: but, peace! let's hear 'em.</div>
                     <h3 class="bridgehead">SONG.</h3>
                     <div class="line">Who is Silvia? what is she,</div>
                     <div class="line">That all our swains commend her?</div>
                     <div class="line">Holy, fair and wise is she;</div>
                     <div class="line">The heaven such grace did lend her,</div>
                     <div class="line">That she might admired be.</div>
                     <div class="line">Is she kind as she is fair?</div>
                     <div class="line">For beauty lives with kindness.</div>
                     <div class="line">Love doth to her eyes repair,</div>
                     <div class="line">To help him of his blindness,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, being help'd, inhabits there.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then to Silvia let us sing,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Silvia is excelling;</div>
                     <div class="line">She excels each mortal thing</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the dull earth dwelling:</div>
                     <div class="line">To her let us garlands bring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! are you sadder than you were before? How</div>
                     <div class="line">do you, man? the music likes you not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You mistake; the musician likes me not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, my pretty youth?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He plays false, father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">How? out of tune on the strings?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so; but yet so false that he grieves my very</div>
                     <div class="line">heart-strings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">You have a quick ear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, I would I were deaf; it makes me have a slow heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">I perceive you delight not in music.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Not a whit, when it jars so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark, what fine change is in the music!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, that change is the spite.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">You would have them always play but one thing?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I would always have one play but one thing.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, host, doth this Sir Proteus that we talk on</div>
                     <div class="line">Often resort unto this gentlewoman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell you what Launce, his man, told me: he loved</div>
                     <div class="line">her out of all nick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is Launce?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Gone to seek his dog; which tomorrow, by his</div>
                     <div class="line">master's command, he must carry for a present to his lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace! stand aside: the company parts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Thurio, fear not you: I will so plead</div>
                     <div class="line">That you shall say my cunning drift excels.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Where meet we?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">At Saint Gregory's well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt THURIO and Musicians</p>
               <p>Enter SILVIA above</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, good even to your ladyship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you for your music, gentlemen.</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is that that spake?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">One, lady, if you knew his pure heart's truth,</div>
                     <div class="line">You would quickly learn to know him by his voice.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Proteus, as I take it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Proteus, gentle lady, and your servant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What's your will?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That I may compass yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You have your wish; my will is even this:</div>
                     <div class="line">That presently you hie you home to bed.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou subtle, perjured, false, disloyal man!</div>
                     <div class="line">Think'st thou I am so shallow, so conceitless,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be seduced by thy flattery,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hast deceived so many with thy vows?</div>
                     <div class="line">Return, return, and make thy love amends.</div>
                     <div class="line">For me, by this pale queen of night I swear,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am so far from granting thy request</div>
                     <div class="line">That I despise thee for thy wrongful suit,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by and by intend to chide myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Even for this time I spend in talking to thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I grant, sweet love, that I did love a lady;</div>
                     <div class="line">But she is dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>        'Twere false, if I should speak it;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am sure she is not buried.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Say that she be; yet Valentine thy friend</div>
                     <div class="line">Survives; to whom, thyself art witness,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am betroth'd: and art thou not ashamed</div>
                     <div class="line">To wrong him with thy importunacy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I likewise hear that Valentine is dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">And so suppose am I; for in his grave</div>
                     <div class="line">Assure thyself my love is buried.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet lady, let me rake it from the earth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to thy lady's grave and call hers thence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, at the least, in hers sepulchre thine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  He heard not that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, if your heart be so obdurate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Vouchsafe me yet your picture for my love,</div>
                     <div class="line">The picture that is hanging in your chamber;</div>
                     <div class="line">To that I'll speak, to that I'll sigh and weep:</div>
                     <div class="line">For since the substance of your perfect self</div>
                     <div class="line">Is else devoted, I am but a shadow;</div>
                     <div class="line">And to your shadow will I make true love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  If 'twere a substance, you would, sure,</div>
                     <div class="line">deceive it,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make it but a shadow, as I am.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I am very loath to be your idol, sir;</div>
                     <div class="line">But since your falsehood shall become you well</div>
                     <div class="line">To worship shadows and adore false shapes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Send to me in the morning and I'll send it:</div>
                     <div class="line">And so, good rest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">As wretches have o'ernight</div>
                     <div class="line">That wait for execution in the morn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt PROTEUS and SILVIA severally</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Host, will you go?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">By my halidom, I was fast asleep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, where lies Sir Proteus?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, at my house. Trust me, I think 'tis almost</div>
                     <div class="line">day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so; but it hath been the longest night</div>
                     <div class="line">That e'er I watch'd and the most heaviest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter EGLAMOUR</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EGLAMOUR</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the hour that Madam Silvia</div>
                     <div class="line">Entreated me to call and know her mind:</div>
                     <div class="line">There's some great matter she'ld employ me in.</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, madam!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SILVIA above</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Who calls?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EGLAMOUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Your servant and your friend;</div>
                     <div class="line">One that attends your ladyship's command.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Eglamour, a thousand times good morrow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EGLAMOUR</div>
                     <div class="line">As many, worthy lady, to yourself:</div>
                     <div class="line">According to your ladyship's impose,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thus early come to know what service</div>
                     <div class="line">It is your pleasure to command me in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O Eglamour, thou art a gentleman--</div>
                     <div class="line">Think not I flatter, for I swear I do not--</div>
                     <div class="line">Valiant, wise, remorseful, well accomplish'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art not ignorant what dear good will</div>
                     <div class="line">I bear unto the banish'd Valentine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor how my father would enforce me marry</div>
                     <div class="line">Vain Thurio, whom my very soul abhors.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thyself hast loved; and I have heard thee say</div>
                     <div class="line">No grief did ever come so near thy heart</div>
                     <div class="line">As when thy lady and thy true love died,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon whose grave thou vow'dst pure chastity.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Eglamour, I would to Valentine,</div>
                     <div class="line">To Mantua, where I hear he makes abode;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, for the ways are dangerous to pass,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do desire thy worthy company,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon whose faith and honour I repose.</div>
                     <div class="line">Urge not my father's anger, Eglamour,</div>
                     <div class="line">But think upon my grief, a lady's grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">And on the justice of my flying hence,</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep me from a most unholy match,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which heaven and fortune still rewards with plagues.</div>
                     <div class="line">I do desire thee, even from a heart</div>
                     <div class="line">As full of sorrows as the sea of sands,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bear me company and go with me:</div>
                     <div class="line">If not, to hide what I have said to thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I may venture to depart alone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EGLAMOUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I pity much your grievances;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which since I know they virtuously are placed,</div>
                     <div class="line">I give consent to go along with you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Recking as little what betideth me</div>
                     <div class="line">As much I wish all good befortune you.</div>
                     <div class="line">When will you go?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">This evening coming.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EGLAMOUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Where shall I meet you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">At Friar Patrick's cell,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where I intend holy confession.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EGLAMOUR</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not fail your ladyship. Good morrow, gentle lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, kind Sir Eglamour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt severally</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LAUNCE, with his his Dog</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">When a man's servant shall play the cur with him,</div>
                     <div class="line">look you, it goes hard: one that I brought up of a</div>
                     <div class="line">puppy; one that I saved from drowning, when three or</div>
                     <div class="line">four of his blind brothers and sisters went to it.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have taught him, even as one would say precisely,</div>
                     <div class="line">'thus I would teach a dog.' I was sent to deliver</div>
                     <div class="line">him as a present to Mistress Silvia from my master;</div>
                     <div class="line">and I came no sooner into the dining-chamber but he</div>
                     <div class="line">steps me to her trencher and steals her capon's leg:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, 'tis a foul thing when a cur cannot keep himself</div>
                     <div class="line">in all companies! I would have, as one should say,</div>
                     <div class="line">one that takes upon him to be a dog indeed, to be,</div>
                     <div class="line">as it were, a dog at all things. If I had not had</div>
                     <div class="line">more wit than he, to take a fault upon me that he did,</div>
                     <div class="line">I think verily he had been hanged for't; sure as I</div>
                     <div class="line">live, he had suffered for't; you shall judge. He</div>
                     <div class="line">thrusts me himself into the company of three or four</div>
                     <div class="line">gentlemanlike dogs under the duke's table: he had</div>
                     <div class="line">not been there--bless the mark!--a pissing while, but</div>
                     <div class="line">all the chamber smelt him. 'Out with the dog!' says</div>
                     <div class="line">one: 'What cur is that?' says another: 'Whip him</div>
                     <div class="line">out' says the third: 'Hang him up' says the duke.</div>
                     <div class="line">I, having been acquainted with the smell before,</div>
                     <div class="line">knew it was Crab, and goes me to the fellow that</div>
                     <div class="line">whips the dogs: 'Friend,' quoth I, 'you mean to whip</div>
                     <div class="line">the dog?' 'Ay, marry, do I,' quoth he. 'You do him</div>
                     <div class="line">the more wrong,' quoth I; ''twas I did the thing you</div>
                     <div class="line">wot of.' He makes me no more ado, but whips me out</div>
                     <div class="line">of the chamber. How many masters would do this for</div>
                     <div class="line">his servant? Nay, I'll be sworn, I have sat in the</div>
                     <div class="line">stocks for puddings he hath stolen, otherwise he had</div>
                     <div class="line">been executed; I have stood on the pillory for geese</div>
                     <div class="line">he hath killed, otherwise he had suffered for't.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou thinkest not of this now. Nay, I remember the</div>
                     <div class="line">trick you served me when I took my leave of Madam</div>
                     <div class="line">Silvia: did not I bid thee still mark me and do as I</div>
                     <div class="line">do? when didst thou see me heave up my leg and make</div>
                     <div class="line">water against a gentlewoman's farthingale? didst</div>
                     <div class="line">thou ever see me do such a trick?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PROTEUS and JULIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sebastian is thy name? I like thee well</div>
                     <div class="line">And will employ thee in some service presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">In what you please: I'll do what I can.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope thou wilt.</div>
                     <p>To LAUNCE</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, you whoreson peasant!</div>
                     <div class="line">Where have you been these two days loitering?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, I carried Mistress Silvia the dog you bade me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And what says she to my little jewel?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, she says your dog was a cur, and tells you</div>
                     <div class="line">currish thanks is good enough for such a present.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">But she received my dog?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, indeed, did she not: here have I brought him</div>
                     <div class="line">back again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What, didst thou offer her this from me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir: the other squirrel was stolen from me by</div>
                     <div class="line">the hangman boys in the market-place: and then I</div>
                     <div class="line">offered her mine own, who is a dog as big as ten of</div>
                     <div class="line">yours, and therefore the gift the greater.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go get thee hence, and find my dog again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or ne'er return again into my sight.</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, I say! stay'st thou to vex me here?</div>
                     <p>Exit LAUNCE</p>
                     <div class="line">A slave, that still an end turns me to shame!</div>
                     <div class="line">Sebastian, I have entertained thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Partly that I have need of such a youth</div>
                     <div class="line">That can with some discretion do my business,</div>
                     <div class="line">For 'tis no trusting to yond foolish lout,</div>
                     <div class="line">But chiefly for thy face and thy behavior,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, if my augury deceive me not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Witness good bringing up, fortune and truth:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore know thou, for this I entertain thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go presently and take this ring with thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver it to Madam Silvia:</div>
                     <div class="line">She loved me well deliver'd it to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">It seems you loved not her, to leave her token.</div>
                     <div class="line">She is dead, belike?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so; I think she lives.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why dost thou cry 'alas'?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot choose</div>
                     <div class="line">But pity her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherefore shouldst thou pity her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Because methinks that she loved you as well</div>
                     <div class="line">As you do love your lady Silvia:</div>
                     <div class="line">She dreams of him that has forgot her love;</div>
                     <div class="line">You dote on her that cares not for your love.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis pity love should be so contrary;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thinking of it makes me cry 'alas!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, give her that ring and therewithal</div>
                     <div class="line">This letter. That's her chamber. Tell my lady</div>
                     <div class="line">I claim the promise for her heavenly picture.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your message done, hie home unto my chamber,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where thou shalt find me, sad and solitary.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">How many women would do such a message?</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor Proteus! thou hast entertain'd</div>
                     <div class="line">A fox to be the shepherd of thy lambs.</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor fool! why do I pity him</div>
                     <div class="line">That with his very heart despiseth me?</div>
                     <div class="line">Because he loves her, he despiseth me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Because I love him I must pity him.</div>
                     <div class="line">This ring I gave him when he parted from me,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bind him to remember my good will;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now am I, unhappy messenger,</div>
                     <div class="line">To plead for that which I would not obtain,</div>
                     <div class="line">To carry that which I would have refused,</div>
                     <div class="line">To praise his faith which I would have dispraised.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am my master's true-confirmed love;</div>
                     <div class="line">But cannot be true servant to my master,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless I prove false traitor to myself.</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet will I woo for him, but yet so coldly</div>
                     <div class="line">As, heaven it knows, I would not have him speed.</div>
                     <p>Enter SILVIA, attended</p>
                     <div class="line">Gentlewoman, good day! I pray you, be my mean</div>
                     <div class="line">To bring me where to speak with Madam Silvia.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What would you with her, if that I be she?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">If you be she, I do entreat your patience</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear me speak the message I am sent on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">From whom?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">From my master, Sir Proteus, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, he sends you for a picture.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ursula, bring my picture here.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go give your master this: tell him from me,</div>
                     <div class="line">One Julia, that his changing thoughts forget,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would better fit his chamber than this shadow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, please you peruse this letter.--</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, madam; I have unadvised</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver'd you a paper that I should not:</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the letter to your ladyship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, let me look on that again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">It may not be; good madam, pardon me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">There, hold!</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not look upon your master's lines:</div>
                     <div class="line">I know they are stuff'd with protestations</div>
                     <div class="line">And full of new-found oaths; which he will break</div>
                     <div class="line">As easily as I do tear his paper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, he sends your ladyship this ring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">The more shame for him that he sends it me;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I have heard him say a thousand times</div>
                     <div class="line">His Julia gave it him at his departure.</div>
                     <div class="line">Though his false finger have profaned the ring,</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine shall not do his Julia so much wrong.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">She thanks you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What say'st thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you, madam, that you tender her.</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor gentlewoman! my master wrongs her much.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou know her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Almost as well as I do know myself:</div>
                     <div class="line">To think upon her woes I do protest</div>
                     <div class="line">That I have wept a hundred several times.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Belike she thinks that Proteus hath forsook her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I think she doth; and that's her cause of sorrow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Is she not passing fair?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">She hath been fairer, madam, than she is:</div>
                     <div class="line">When she did think my master loved her well,</div>
                     <div class="line">She, in my judgment, was as fair as you:</div>
                     <div class="line">But since she did neglect her looking-glass</div>
                     <div class="line">And threw her sun-expelling mask away,</div>
                     <div class="line">The air hath starved the roses in her cheeks</div>
                     <div class="line">And pinch'd the lily-tincture of her face,</div>
                     <div class="line">That now she is become as black as I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">How tall was she?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">About my stature; for at Pentecost,</div>
                     <div class="line">When all our pageants of delight were play'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our youth got me to play the woman's part,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I was trimm'd in Madam Julia's gown,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which served me as fit, by all men's judgments,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if the garment had been made for me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore I know she is about my height.</div>
                     <div class="line">And at that time I made her weep agood,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I did play a lamentable part:</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, 'twas Ariadne passioning</div>
                     <div class="line">For Theseus' perjury and unjust flight;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I so lively acted with my tears</div>
                     <div class="line">That my poor mistress, moved therewithal,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wept bitterly; and would I might be dead</div>
                     <div class="line">If I in thought felt not her very sorrow!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                     <div class="line">She is beholding to thee, gentle youth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor lady, desolate and left!</div>
                     <div class="line">I weep myself to think upon thy words.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, youth, there is my purse; I give thee this</div>
                     <div class="line">For thy sweet mistress' sake, because thou lovest her.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit SILVIA, with attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                     <div class="line">And she shall thank you for't, if e'er you know her.</div>
                     <div class="line">A virtuous gentlewoman, mild and beautiful</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope my master's suit will be but cold,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since she respects my mistress' love so much.</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, how love can trifle with itself!</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is her picture: let me see; I think,</div>
                     <div class="line">If I had such a tire, this face of mine</div>
                     <div class="line">Were full as lovely as is this of hers:</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet the painter flatter'd her a little,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless I flatter with myself too much.</div>
                     <div class="line">Her hair is auburn, mine is perfect yellow:</div>
                     <div class="line">If that be all the difference in his love,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll get me such a colour'd periwig.</div>
                     <div class="line">Her eyes are grey as glass, and so are mine:</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but her forehead's low, and mine's as high.</div>
                     <div class="line">What should it be that he respects in her</div>
                     <div class="line">But I can make respective in myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">If this fond Love were not a blinded god?</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, shadow, come and take this shadow up,</div>
                     <div class="line">For 'tis thy rival. O thou senseless form,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt be worshipp'd, kiss'd, loved and adored!</div>
                     <div class="line">And, were there sense in his idolatry,</div>
                     <div class="line">My substance should be statue in thy stead.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll use thee kindly for thy mistress' sake,</div>
                     <div class="line">That used me so; or else, by Jove I vow,</div>
                     <div class="line">I should have scratch'd out your unseeing eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">To make my master out of love with thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
