                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">And what says she to my little jewel?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, she says your dog was a cur, and tells you</div>
                              <div class="line">currish thanks is good enough for such a present.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">But she received my dog?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                              <div class="line">No, indeed, did she not: here have I brought him</div>
                              <div class="line">back again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What, didst thou offer her this from me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, sir: the other squirrel was stolen from me by</div>
                              <div class="line">the hangman boys in the market-place: and then I</div>
                              <div class="line">offered her mine own, who is a dog as big as ten of</div>
                              <div class="line">yours, and therefore the gift the greater.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Go get thee hence, and find my dog again,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or ne'er return again into my sight.</div>
                              <div class="line">Away, I say! stay'st thou to vex me here?</div>
                              <p>Exit LAUNCE</p>
                              <div class="line">A slave, that still an end turns me to shame!</div>
                              <div class="line">Sebastian, I have entertained thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Partly that I have need of such a youth</div>
                              <div class="line">That can with some discretion do my business,</div>
                              <div class="line">For 'tis no trusting to yond foolish lout,</div>
                              <div class="line">But chiefly for thy face and thy behavior,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, if my augury deceive me not,</div>
                              <div class="line">Witness good bringing up, fortune and truth:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore know thou, for this I entertain thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go presently and take this ring with thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Deliver it to Madam Silvia:</div>
                              <div class="line">She loved me well deliver'd it to me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">It seems you loved not her, to leave her token.</div>
                              <div class="line">She is dead, belike?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Not so; I think she lives.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why dost thou cry 'alas'?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot choose</div>
                              <div class="line">But pity her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherefore shouldst thou pity her?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Because methinks that she loved you as well</div>
                              <div class="line">As you do love your lady Silvia:</div>
                              <div class="line">She dreams of him that has forgot her love;</div>
                              <div class="line">You dote on her that cares not for your love.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis pity love should be so contrary;</div>
                              <div class="line">And thinking of it makes me cry 'alas!'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, give her that ring and therewithal</div>
                              <div class="line">This letter. That's her chamber. Tell my lady</div>
                              <div class="line">I claim the promise for her heavenly picture.</div>
                              <div class="line">Your message done, hie home unto my chamber,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where thou shalt find me, sad and solitary.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">How many women would do such a message?</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, poor Proteus! thou hast entertain'd</div>
                              <div class="line">A fox to be the shepherd of thy lambs.</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, poor fool! why do I pity him</div>
                              <div class="line">That with his very heart despiseth me?</div>
                              <div class="line">Because he loves her, he despiseth me;</div>
                              <div class="line">Because I love him I must pity him.</div>
                              <div class="line">This ring I gave him when he parted from me,</div>
                              <div class="line">To bind him to remember my good will;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now am I, unhappy messenger,</div>
                              <div class="line">To plead for that which I would not obtain,</div>
                              <div class="line">To carry that which I would have refused,</div>
                              <div class="line">To praise his faith which I would have dispraised.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am my master's true-confirmed love;</div>
                              <div class="line">But cannot be true servant to my master,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless I prove false traitor to myself.</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet will I woo for him, but yet so coldly</div>
                              <div class="line">As, heaven it knows, I would not have him speed.</div>
                              <p>Enter SILVIA, attended</p>
                              <div class="line">Gentlewoman, good day! I pray you, be my mean</div>
                              <div class="line">To bring me where to speak with Madam Silvia.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What would you with her, if that I be she?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">If you be she, I do entreat your patience</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear me speak the message I am sent on.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">From whom?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">From my master, Sir Proteus, madam.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, he sends you for a picture.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, madam.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ursula, bring my picture here.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go give your master this: tell him from me,</div>
                              <div class="line">One Julia, that his changing thoughts forget,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would better fit his chamber than this shadow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, please you peruse this letter.--</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon me, madam; I have unadvised</div>
                              <div class="line">Deliver'd you a paper that I should not:</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the letter to your ladyship.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray thee, let me look on that again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">It may not be; good madam, pardon me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">There, hold!</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not look upon your master's lines:</div>
                              <div class="line">I know they are stuff'd with protestations</div>
                              <div class="line">And full of new-found oaths; which he will break</div>
                              <div class="line">As easily as I do tear his paper.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, he sends your ladyship this ring.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">The more shame for him that he sends it me;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I have heard him say a thousand times</div>
                              <div class="line">His Julia gave it him at his departure.</div>
                              <div class="line">Though his false finger have profaned the ring,</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine shall not do his Julia so much wrong.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">She thanks you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What say'st thou?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank you, madam, that you tender her.</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor gentlewoman! my master wrongs her much.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost thou know her?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Almost as well as I do know myself:</div>
                              <div class="line">To think upon her woes I do protest</div>
                              <div class="line">That I have wept a hundred several times.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Belike she thinks that Proteus hath forsook her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I think she doth; and that's her cause of sorrow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Is she not passing fair?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">She hath been fairer, madam, than she is:</div>
                              <div class="line">When she did think my master loved her well,</div>
                              <div class="line">She, in my judgment, was as fair as you:</div>
                              <div class="line">But since she did neglect her looking-glass</div>
                              <div class="line">And threw her sun-expelling mask away,</div>
                              <div class="line">The air hath starved the roses in her cheeks</div>
                              <div class="line">And pinch'd the lily-tincture of her face,</div>
                              <div class="line">That now she is become as black as I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">How tall was she?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">About my stature; for at Pentecost,</div>
                              <div class="line">When all our pageants of delight were play'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our youth got me to play the woman's part,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I was trimm'd in Madam Julia's gown,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which served me as fit, by all men's judgments,</div>
                              <div class="line">As if the garment had been made for me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore I know she is about my height.</div>
                              <div class="line">And at that time I made her weep agood,</div>
                              <div class="line">For I did play a lamentable part:</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, 'twas Ariadne passioning</div>
                              <div class="line">For Theseus' perjury and unjust flight;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I so lively acted with my tears</div>
                              <div class="line">That my poor mistress, moved therewithal,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wept bitterly; and would I might be dead</div>
                              <div class="line">If I in thought felt not her very sorrow!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">She is beholding to thee, gentle youth.</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, poor lady, desolate and left!</div>
                              <div class="line">I weep myself to think upon thy words.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, youth, there is my purse; I give thee this</div>
                              <div class="line">For thy sweet mistress' sake, because thou lovest her.</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit SILVIA, with attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">And she shall thank you for't, if e'er you know her.</div>
                              <div class="line">A virtuous gentlewoman, mild and beautiful</div>
                              <div class="line">I hope my master's suit will be but cold,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since she respects my mistress' love so much.</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, how love can trifle with itself!</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is her picture: let me see; I think,</div>
                              <div class="line">If I had such a tire, this face of mine</div>
                              <div class="line">Were full as lovely as is this of hers:</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet the painter flatter'd her a little,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless I flatter with myself too much.</div>
                              <div class="line">Her hair is auburn, mine is perfect yellow:</div>
                              <div class="line">If that be all the difference in his love,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll get me such a colour'd periwig.</div>
                              <div class="line">Her eyes are grey as glass, and so are mine:</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, but her forehead's low, and mine's as high.</div>
                              <div class="line">What should it be that he respects in her</div>
                              <div class="line">But I can make respective in myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">If this fond Love were not a blinded god?</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, shadow, come and take this shadow up,</div>
                              <div class="line">For 'tis thy rival. O thou senseless form,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou shalt be worshipp'd, kiss'd, loved and adored!</div>
                              <div class="line">And, were there sense in his idolatry,</div>
                              <div class="line">My substance should be statue in thy stead.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll use thee kindly for thy mistress' sake,</div>
                              <div class="line">That used me so; or else, by Jove I vow,</div>
                              <div class="line">I should have scratch'd out your unseeing eyes</div>
                              <div class="line">To make my master out of love with thee!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter EGLAMOUR</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EGLAMOUR</div>
                              <div class="line">The sun begins to gild the western sky;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now it is about the very hour</div>
                              <div class="line">That Silvia, at Friar Patrick's cell, should meet me.</div>
                              <div class="line">She will not fail, for lovers break not hours,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless it be to come before their time;</div>
                              <div class="line">So much they spur their expedition.</div>
                              <div class="line">See where she comes.</div>
                              <p>Enter SILVIA</p>
                              <div class="line">Lady, a happy evening!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Amen, amen! Go on, good Eglamour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Out at the postern by the abbey-wall:</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear I am attended by some spies.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EGLAMOUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Fear not: the forest is not three leagues off;</div>
                              <div class="line">If we recover that, we are sure enough.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter THURIO, PROTEUS, and JULIA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir Proteus, what says Silvia to my suit?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, sir, I find her milder than she was;</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet she takes exceptions at your person.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">What, that my leg is too long?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">No; that it is too little.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll wear a boot, to make it somewhat rounder.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  But love will not be spurr'd to what</div>
                              <div class="line">it loathes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">What says she to my face?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">She says it is a fair one.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay then, the wanton lies; my face is black.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">But pearls are fair; and the old saying is,</div>
                              <div class="line">Black men are pearls in beauteous ladies' eyes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  'Tis true; such pearls as put out</div>
                              <div class="line">ladies' eyes;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I had rather wink than look on them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">How likes she my discourse?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ill, when you talk of war.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">But well, when I discourse of love and peace?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  But better, indeed, when you hold your peace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">What says she to my valour?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, sir, she makes no doubt of that.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  She needs not, when she knows it cowardice.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">What says she to my birth?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">That you are well derived.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  True; from a gentleman to a fool.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Considers she my possessions?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, ay; and pities them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherefore?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  That such an ass should owe them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">That they are out by lease.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes the duke.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter DUKE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, Sir Proteus! how now, Thurio!</div>
                              <div class="line">Which of you saw Sir Eglamour of late?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Not I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">Saw you my daughter?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Neither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">Why then,</div>
                              <div class="line">She's fled unto that peasant Valentine;</div>
                              <div class="line">And Eglamour is in her company.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis true; for Friar Laurence met them both,</div>
                              <div class="line">As he in penance wander'd through the forest;</div>
                              <div class="line">Him he knew well, and guess'd that it was she,</div>
                              <div class="line">But, being mask'd, he was not sure of it;</div>
                              <div class="line">Besides, she did intend confession</div>
                              <div class="line">At Patrick's cell this even; and there she was not;</div>
                              <div class="line">These likelihoods confirm her flight from hence.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, I pray you, stand not to discourse,</div>
                              <div class="line">But mount you presently and meet with me</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the rising of the mountain-foot</div>
                              <div class="line">That leads towards Mantua, whither they are fled:</div>
                              <div class="line">Dispatch, sweet gentlemen, and follow me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, this it is to be a peevish girl,</div>
                              <div class="line">That flies her fortune when it follows her.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll after, more to be revenged on Eglamour</div>
                              <div class="line">Than for the love of reckless Silvia.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will follow, more for Silvia's love</div>
                              <div class="line">Than hate of Eglamour that goes with her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will follow, more to cross that love</div>
                              <div class="line">Than hate for Silvia that is gone for love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter Outlaws with SILVIA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Outlaw</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be patient; we must bring you to our captain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">A thousand more mischances than this one</div>
                              <div class="line">Have learn'd me how to brook this patiently.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Outlaw</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, bring her away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Outlaw</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is the gentleman that was with her?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Outlaw</div>
                              <div class="line">Being nimble-footed, he hath outrun us,</div>
                              <div class="line">But Moyses and Valerius follow him.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go thou with her to the west end of the wood;</div>
                              <div class="line">There is our captain: we'll follow him that's fled;</div>
                              <div class="line">The thicket is beset; he cannot 'scape.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Outlaw</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, I must bring you to our captain's cave:</div>
                              <div class="line">Fear not; he bears an honourable mind,</div>
                              <div class="line">And will not use a woman lawlessly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O Valentine, this I endure for thee!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter VALENTINE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">How use doth breed a habit in a man!</div>
                              <div class="line">This shadowy desert, unfrequented woods,</div>
                              <div class="line">I better brook than flourishing peopled towns:</div>
                              <div class="line">Here can I sit alone, unseen of any,</div>
                              <div class="line">And to the nightingale's complaining notes</div>
                              <div class="line">Tune my distresses and record my woes.</div>
                              <div class="line">O thou that dost inhabit in my breast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave not the mansion so long tenantless,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest, growing ruinous, the building fall</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave no memory of what it was!</div>
                              <div class="line">Repair me with thy presence, Silvia;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou gentle nymph, cherish thy forlorn swain!</div>
                              <div class="line">What halloing and what stir is this to-day?</div>
                              <div class="line">These are my mates, that make their wills their law,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have some unhappy passenger in chase.</div>
                              <div class="line">They love me well; yet I have much to do</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep them from uncivil outrages.</div>
                              <div class="line">Withdraw thee, Valentine: who's this comes here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter PROTEUS, SILVIA, and JULIA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, this service I have done for you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though you respect not aught your servant doth,</div>
                              <div class="line">To hazard life and rescue you from him</div>
                              <div class="line">That would have forced your honour and your love;</div>
                              <div class="line">Vouchsafe me, for my meed, but one fair look;</div>
                              <div class="line">A smaller boon than this I cannot beg</div>
                              <div class="line">And less than this, I am sure, you cannot give.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  How like a dream is this I see and hear!</div>
                              <div class="line">Love, lend me patience to forbear awhile.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O miserable, unhappy that I am!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Unhappy were you, madam, ere I came;</div>
                              <div class="line">But by my coming I have made you happy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">By thy approach thou makest me most unhappy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  And me, when he approacheth to your presence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Had I been seized by a hungry lion,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would have been a breakfast to the beast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rather than have false Proteus rescue me.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, Heaven be judge how I love Valentine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose life's as tender to me as my soul!</div>
                              <div class="line">And full as much, for more there cannot be,</div>
                              <div class="line">I do detest false perjured Proteus.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore be gone; solicit me no more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What dangerous action, stood it next to death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would I not undergo for one calm look!</div>
                              <div class="line">O, 'tis the curse in love, and still approved,</div>
                              <div class="line">When women cannot love where they're beloved!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">When Proteus cannot love where he's beloved.</div>
                              <div class="line">Read over Julia's heart, thy first best love,</div>
                              <div class="line">For whose dear sake thou didst then rend thy faith</div>
                              <div class="line">Into a thousand oaths; and all those oaths</div>
                              <div class="line">Descended into perjury, to love me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast no faith left now, unless thou'dst two;</div>
                              <div class="line">And that's far worse than none; better have none</div>
                              <div class="line">Than plural faith which is too much by one:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou counterfeit to thy true friend!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">In love</div>
                              <div class="line">Who respects friend?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">All men but Proteus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, if the gentle spirit of moving words</div>
                              <div class="line">Can no way change you to a milder form,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll woo you like a soldier, at arms' end,</div>
                              <div class="line">And love you 'gainst the nature of love,--force ye.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O heaven!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll force thee yield to my desire.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">Ruffian, let go that rude uncivil touch,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou friend of an ill fashion!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Valentine!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou common friend, that's without faith or love,</div>
                              <div class="line">For such is a friend now; treacherous man!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast beguiled my hopes; nought but mine eye</div>
                              <div class="line">Could have persuaded me: now I dare not say</div>
                              <div class="line">I have one friend alive; thou wouldst disprove me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who should be trusted, when one's own right hand</div>
                              <div class="line">Is perjured to the bosom? Proteus,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am sorry I must never trust thee more,</div>
                              <div class="line">But count the world a stranger for thy sake.</div>
                              <div class="line">The private wound is deepest: O time most accurst,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Mongst all foes that a friend should be the worst!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">My shame and guilt confounds me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Forgive me, Valentine: if hearty sorrow</div>
                              <div class="line">Be a sufficient ransom for offence,</div>
                              <div class="line">I tender 't here; I do as truly suffer</div>
                              <div class="line">As e'er I did commit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">Then I am paid;</div>
                              <div class="line">And once again I do receive thee honest.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who by repentance is not satisfied</div>
                              <div class="line">Is nor of heaven nor earth, for these are pleased.</div>
                              <div class="line">By penitence the Eternal's wrath's appeased:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, that my love may appear plain and free,</div>
                              <div class="line">All that was mine in Silvia I give thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O me unhappy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Swoons</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Look to the boy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, boy! why, wag! how now! what's the matter?</div>
                              <div class="line">Look up; speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O good sir, my master charged me to deliver a ring</div>
                              <div class="line">to Madam Silvia, which, out of my neglect, was never done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is that ring, boy?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Here 'tis; this is it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">How! let me see:</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, this is the ring I gave to Julia.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, cry you mercy, sir, I have mistook:</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the ring you sent to Silvia.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">But how camest thou by this ring? At my depart</div>
                              <div class="line">I gave this unto Julia.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">And Julia herself did give it me;</div>
                              <div class="line">And Julia herself hath brought it hither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">How! Julia!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Behold her that gave aim to all thy oaths,</div>
                              <div class="line">And entertain'd 'em deeply in her heart.</div>
                              <div class="line">How oft hast thou with perjury cleft the root!</div>
                              <div class="line">O Proteus, let this habit make thee blush!</div>
                              <div class="line">Be thou ashamed that I have took upon me</div>
                              <div class="line">Such an immodest raiment, if shame live</div>
                              <div class="line">In a disguise of love:</div>
                              <div class="line">It is the lesser blot, modesty finds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Women to change their shapes than men their minds.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Than men their minds! 'tis true.</div>
                              <div class="line">O heaven! were man</div>
                              <div class="line">But constant, he were perfect. That one error</div>
                              <div class="line">Fills him with faults; makes him run through all the sins:</div>
                              <div class="line">Inconstancy falls off ere it begins.</div>
                              <div class="line">What is in Silvia's face, but I may spy</div>
                              <div class="line">More fresh in Julia's with a constant eye?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, a hand from either:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me be blest to make this happy close;</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twere pity two such friends should be long foes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROTEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Bear witness, Heaven, I have my wish for ever.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIA</div>
                              <div class="line">And I mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Outlaws, with DUKE and THURIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Outlaws</div>
                              <div class="line">A prize, a prize, a prize!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">Forbear, forbear, I say! it is my lord the duke.</div>
                              <div class="line">Your grace is welcome to a man disgraced,</div>
                              <div class="line">Banished Valentine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir Valentine!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Yonder is Silvia; and Silvia's mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">Thurio, give back, or else embrace thy death;</div>
                              <div class="line">Come not within the measure of my wrath;</div>
                              <div class="line">Do not name Silvia thine; if once again,</div>
                              <div class="line">Verona shall not hold thee. Here she stands;</div>
                              <div class="line">Take but possession of her with a touch:</div>
                              <div class="line">I dare thee but to breathe upon my love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THURIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir Valentine, I care not for her, I;</div>
                              <div class="line">I hold him but a fool that will endanger</div>
                              <div class="line">His body for a girl that loves him not:</div>
                              <div class="line">I claim her not, and therefore she is thine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">The more degenerate and base art thou,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make such means for her as thou hast done</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave her on such slight conditions.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by the honour of my ancestry,</div>
                              <div class="line">I do applaud thy spirit, Valentine,</div>
                              <div class="line">And think thee worthy of an empress' love:</div>
                              <div class="line">Know then, I here forget all former griefs,</div>
                              <div class="line">Cancel all grudge, repeal thee home again,</div>
                              <div class="line">Plead a new state in thy unrivall'd merit,</div>
                              <div class="line">To which I thus subscribe: Sir Valentine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art a gentleman and well derived;</div>
                              <div class="line">Take thou thy Silvia, for thou hast deserved her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank your grace; the gift hath made me happy.</div>
                              <div class="line">I now beseech you, for your daughter's sake,</div>
                              <div class="line">To grant one boom that I shall ask of you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">I grant it, for thine own, whate'er it be.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">These banish'd men that I have kept withal</div>
                              <div class="line">Are men endued with worthy qualities:</div>
                              <div class="line">Forgive them what they have committed here</div>
                              <div class="line">And let them be recall'd from their exile:</div>
                              <div class="line">They are reformed, civil, full of good</div>
                              <div class="line">And fit for great employment, worthy lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast prevail'd; I pardon them and thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">Dispose of them as thou know'st their deserts.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, let us go: we will include all jars</div>
                              <div class="line">With triumphs, mirth and rare solemnity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">And, as we walk along, I dare be bold</div>
                              <div class="line">With our discourse to make your grace to smile.</div>
                              <div class="line">What think you of this page, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">I think the boy hath grace in him; he blushes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">I warrant you, my lord, more grace than boy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">What mean you by that saying?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VALENTINE</div>
                              <div class="line">Please you, I'll tell you as we pass along,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you will wonder what hath fortuned.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, Proteus; 'tis your penance but to hear</div>
                              <div class="line">The story of your loves discovered:</div>
                              <div class="line">That done, our day of marriage shall be yours;</div>
                              <div class="line">One feast, one house, one mutual happiness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
         </div>
      </article>

   </body>
</html>
The “current” CSS styling is applied to the this entire document; the results in this column may be anomalous. Also, image links are broken in this column. 

The Two Gentlemen of Verona

Table of Contents

  • 1. Dramatis Personae
  • 1. ACT I
    • 1. SCENE I. Verona. An open place.
    • 2. SCENE II. The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
    • 3. SCENE III. The same. ANTONIO's house.
  • 2. ACT II
    • 1. SCENE I. Milan. The DUKE's palace.
    • 2. SCENE II. Verona. JULIA'S house.
    • 3. SCENE III. The same. A street.
    • 4. SCENE IV. Milan. The DUKE's palace.
    • 5. SCENE V. The same. A street.
    • 6. SCENE VI. The same. The DUKE'S palace.
    • 7. SCENE VII. Verona. JULIA'S house.
  • 3. ACT III
    • 1. SCENE I. Milan. The DUKE's palace.
    • 2. SCENE II. The same. The DUKE's palace.
  • 4. ACT IV
    • 1. SCENE I. The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
    • 2. SCENE II. Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
    • 3. SCENE III. The same.
    • 4. SCENE IV. The same.
  • 5. ACT V
    • 1. SCENE I. Milan. An abbey.
    • 2. SCENE II. The same. The DUKE's palace.
    • 3. SCENE III. The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
    • 4. SCENE IV. Another part of the forest.

Dramatis Personae

DUKE OF MILAN, Father to Silvia.

VALENTINE PROTEUS the two Gentlemen.

ANTONIO, Father to Proteus.

THURIO, a foolish rival to Valentine.

EGLAMOUR, Agent for Silvia in her escape.

HOST, where Julia lodges.

OUTLAWS, with Valentine.

SPEED, a clownish servant to Valentine.

LAUNCE, the like to Proteus.

PANTHINO, Servant to Antonio.

JULIA, beloved of Proteus.

SILVIA, beloved of Valentine.

LUCETTA, waiting-woman to Julia.

Servants, Musicians.

SCENE Verona; Milan; the frontiers of Mantua.

Chapter 1. ACT I

Table of Contents

  • 1. SCENE I. Verona. An open place.
  • 2. SCENE II. The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
  • 3. SCENE III. The same. ANTONIO's house.

1. SCENE I. Verona. An open place.

Enter VALENTINE and PROTEUS

VALENTINE
Cease to persuade, my loving Proteus:
Home-keeping youth have ever homely wits.
Were't not affection chains thy tender days
To the sweet glances of thy honour'd love,
I rather would entreat thy company
To see the wonders of the world abroad,
Than, living dully sluggardized at home,
Wear out thy youth with shapeless idleness.
But since thou lovest, love still and thrive therein,
Even as I would when I to love begin.
PROTEUS
Wilt thou be gone? Sweet Valentine, adieu!
Think on thy Proteus, when thou haply seest
Some rare note-worthy object in thy travel:
Wish me partaker in thy happiness
When thou dost meet good hap; and in thy danger,
If ever danger do environ thee,
Commend thy grievance to my holy prayers,
For I will be thy beadsman, Valentine.
VALENTINE
And on a love-book pray for my success?
PROTEUS
Upon some book I love I'll pray for thee.
VALENTINE
That's on some shallow story of deep love:
How young Leander cross'd the Hellespont.
PROTEUS
That's a deep story of a deeper love:
For he was more than over shoes in love.
VALENTINE
'Tis true; for you are over boots in love,
And yet you never swum the Hellespont.
PROTEUS
Over the boots? nay, give me not the boots.
VALENTINE
No, I will not, for it boots thee not.
PROTEUS
What?
VALENTINE
To be in love, where scorn is bought with groans;
Coy looks with heart-sore sighs; one fading moment's mirth
With twenty watchful, weary, tedious nights:
If haply won, perhaps a hapless gain;
If lost, why then a grievous labour won;
However, but a folly bought with wit,
Or else a wit by folly vanquished.
PROTEUS
So, by your circumstance, you call me fool.
VALENTINE
So, by your circumstance, I fear you'll prove.
PROTEUS
'Tis love you cavil at: I am not Love.
VALENTINE
Love is your master, for he masters you:
And he that is so yoked by a fool,
Methinks, should not be chronicled for wise.
PROTEUS
Yet writers say, as in the sweetest bud
The eating canker dwells, so eating love
Inhabits in the finest wits of all.
VALENTINE
And writers say, as the most forward bud
